summary: This document outlines the operational approach and planning objectives for FBI CID Branch I, which oversees investigations into five major criminal violations including Violent Crimes Against Children. It describes four lines of effort: technology planning, threat prioritization, operations-intelligence integration, and resource alignment across 56 field offices.
keyFacts: FBI CID Branch I oversees investigations into five major criminal violations: Violent Crime, Gangs, Narcotics, Transnational Organized Crime (x2), and Violent Crimes Against Children.
The branch coordinates investigative activities across 56 field offices and multiple sections.
The operational approach includes four lines of effort: Technology Planning & Integration, Threat Prioritization & Guidance, Operations-Intelligence Integration, and Resource Alignment.
The document emphasizes maximizing investigative creativity in field offices while focusing efforts to achieve FBI, DOJ, national, and international threat-based objectives.
CID Branch I serves as the coordinating unit for technology needs analysis, identification, acquisition, and field integration to act as a force multiplier for criminal investigations.
